005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util;
007
008import java.util.ArrayList;
009import java.util.Arrays;
010import java.util.Collection;
011import java.util.Collections;
012import java.util.Iterator;
013import java.util.LinkedList;
014import java.util.List;
015import java.util.Map;
016import java.util.Set;
017import java.util.Spliterator;
018import java.util.Spliterators;
019import java.util.stream.Collectors;
020import java.util.stream.IntStream;
021import java.util.stream.Stream;
022import java.util.stream.StreamSupport;
023
024import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
025import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
026
027@SuppressWarnings("PMD.CouplingBetweenObjects")
028public final class CollectionUtil {
029  /**
030   * Get a {@link Stream} for the provided {@link Iterable}.
031   *
032   * @param <T>
033   *          the type to iterate on
034   * @param iterator
035   *          the iterator
036   * @return the stream
037   */
038  public static <T> Stream<T> toStream(@NonNull Iterator<T> iterator) {
039    Iterable<T> iterable = toIterable(iterator);
040    return StreamSupport.stream(iterable.spliterator(), false);
041  }
042
043  /**
044   * Get an {@link Iterable} for the provided {@link Stream}.
045   *
046   * @param <T>
047   *          the type to iterate on
048   * @param stream
049   *          the stream to iterate over
050   * @return the resulting iterable instance
051   */
052  @NonNull
053  public static <T> Iterable<T> toIterable(@NonNull Stream<T> stream) {
054    return toIterable(ObjectUtils.notNull(stream.iterator()));
055  }
056
057  /**
058   * Get an {@link Iterable} for the provided {@link Iterator}.
059   *
060   * @param <T>
061   *          the type to iterate on
062   * @param iterator
063   *          the iterator
064   * @return the resulting iterable instance
065   */
066  @NonNull
067  public static <T> Iterable<T> toIterable(@NonNull Iterator<T> iterator) {
068    return () -> iterator;
069  }
070
071  /**
072   * Get a reverse {@link Iterable} for the provided {@link List}.
073   *
074   * @param <T>
075   *          the type to iterate on
076   * @param list
077   *          the list of items to iterate over
078   * @return the resulting iterable instance
079   */
080  @NonNull
081  public static <T> Iterable<T> toDescendingIterable(@NonNull List<T> list) {
082    return toIterable(descendingIterator(list));
083  }
084
085  /**
086   * Convert the provided {@link Iterable} to a list of the same generic type.
087   *
088   * @param <T>
089   *          the collection item's generic type
090   * @param iterable
091   *          the Iterable to convert to a list
092   * @return the list
093   */
094  @NonNull
095  public static <T> List<T> toList(Iterable<T> iterable) {
096    return ObjectUtils.notNull(StreamSupport.stream(iterable.spliterator(), false).collect(Collectors.toList()));
097  }
098
099  /**
100   * Convert the provided {@link Iterator} to a list of the same generic type.
101   *
102   * @param <T>
103   *          the collection item's generic type
104   * @param iterator
105   *          the Iterator to convert to a list
106   * @return the list
107   */
108  @NonNull
109  public static <T> List<T> toList(Iterator<T> iterator) {
110    return ObjectUtils.notNull(
111        StreamSupport.stream(Spliterators.spliteratorUnknownSize(iterator, Spliterator.ORDERED), false)
112            .collect(Collectors.toList()));
113  }
114
115  /**
116   * Get a reverse {@link Iterator} for the provided {@link List}.
117   *
118   * @param <T>
119   *          the type to iterate on
120   * @param list
121   *          the list of items to iterate over
122   * @return the resulting Iterator instance
123   */
124  @NonNull
125  public static <T> Iterator<T> descendingIterator(@NonNull List<T> list) {
126    Iterator<T> retval;
127    if (list instanceof LinkedList) {
128      retval = ((LinkedList<T>) list).descendingIterator();
129    } else if (list instanceof ArrayList) {
130      retval = IntStream.range(0, list.size())
131          .map(i -> list.size() - 1 - i)
132          .mapToObj(list::get).iterator();
133    } else {
134      throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
135    }
136    return ObjectUtils.notNull(retval);
137  }
138
139  /**
140   * Require that the provided collection contains at least a single item.
141   *
142   * @param <T>
143   *          the Java type of the collection
144   * @param <U>
145   *          the Java type of the collection's items
146   * @param collection
147   *          the collection to test
148   * @return the provided collection
149   * @throws IllegalStateException
150   *           if the collection is empty
151   */
152  @NonNull
153  public static <T extends Collection<U>, U> T requireNonEmpty(@NonNull T collection) {
154    if (collection.isEmpty()) {
155      throw new IllegalStateException();
156    }
157    return collection;
158  }
159
160  /**
161   * Require that the provided collection contains at least a single item.
162   *
163   * @param <T>
164   *          the Java type of the collection
165   * @param <U>
166   *          the Java type of the collection's items
167   * @param collection
168   *          the collection to test
169   * @param message
170   *          the exception message to use if the collection is empty
171   * @return the provided collection
172   * @throws IllegalStateException
173   *           if the collection is empty
174   */
175  @NonNull
176  public static <T extends Collection<U>, U> T requireNonEmpty(@NonNull T collection, @NonNull String message) {
177    if (collection.isEmpty()) {
178      throw new IllegalStateException(message);
179    }
180    return collection;
181  }
182
183  /**
184   * An implementation of {@link Collections#unmodifiableCollection(Collection)}
185   * that respects non-nullness.
186   *
187   * @param <T>
188   *          the collection's item type
189   * @param collection
190   *          the collection
191   * @return an unmodifiable view of the collection
192   */
193  @SuppressWarnings("null")
194  @NonNull
195  public static <T> Collection<T> unmodifiableCollection(@NonNull Collection<T> collection) {
196    return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(collection);
197  }
198
199  /**
200   * An implementation of {@link Collections#singleton(Object)} that respects
201   * non-nullness.
202   *
203   * @param <T>
204   *          the Java type of the set items
205   * @param instance
206   *          the singleton item to use
207   * @return an unmodifiable set containing the singleton item
208   */
209  @SuppressWarnings("null")
210  @NonNull
211  public static <T> Set<T> singleton(@NonNull T instance) {
212    return Collections.singleton(instance);
213  }
214
215  /**
216   * An implementation of {@link Collections#emptySet()} that respects
217   * non-nullness.
218   *
219   * @param <T>
220   *          the Java type of the set items
221   * @return an unmodifiable empty set
222   */
223  @SuppressWarnings("null")
224  @NonNull
225  public static <T> Set<T> emptySet() {
226    return Collections.emptySet();
227  }
228
229  /**
230   * An implementation of {@link Collections#unmodifiableSet(Set)} that respects
231   * non-nullness.
232   *
233   * @param <T>
234   *          the Java type of the set items
235   * @param set
236   *          the set to prevent modification of
237   * @return an unmodifiable view of the set
238   */
239  @SuppressWarnings("null")
240  @NonNull
241  public static <T> Set<T> unmodifiableSet(@NonNull Set<T> set) {
242    return Collections.unmodifiableSet(set);
243  }
244
245  /**
246   * Provides an unmodifiable list containing the provided list.
247   * <p>
248   * If the provided list is {@code null}, an empty list will be provided.
249   *
250   * @param <T>
251   *          the Java type of the list items
252   * @param list
253   *          the list, which may be {@code null}
254   * @return an unmodifiable list containing the items
255   */
256  @NonNull
257  public static <T> List<T> listOrEmpty(@Nullable List<T> list) {
258    return list == null ? emptyList() : unmodifiableList(list);
259  }
260
261  /**
262   * Generates a new unmodifiable list containing the provided items.
263   * <p>
264   * If the provided array is {@code null}, an empty list will be provided.
265   *
266   * @param <T>
267   *          the Java type of the list items
268   * @param array
269   *          the array of items to use to populate the list, which may be
270   *          {@code null}
271   * @return an unmodifiable list containing the items
272   */
273  @SafeVarargs
274  @SuppressWarnings("null")
275  @NonNull
276  public static <T> List<T> listOrEmpty(@Nullable T... array) {
277    return array == null || array.length == 0 ? emptyList() : unmodifiableList(Arrays.asList(array));
278  }
279
280  /**
281   * An implementation of {@link Collections#emptyList()} that respects
282   * non-nullness.
283   *
284   * @param <T>
285   *          the Java type of the list items
286   * @return an unmodifiable empty list
287   */
288  @SuppressWarnings("null")
289  @NonNull
290  public static <T> List<T> emptyList() {
291    return Collections.emptyList();
292  }
293
294  /**
295   * An implementation of {@link Collections#unmodifiableList(List)} that respects
296   * non-nullness.
297   *
298   * @param <T>
299   *          the Java type of the list items
300   * @param list
301   *          the list to prevent modification of
302   * @return an unmodifiable view of the list
303   */
304  @SuppressWarnings("null")
305  @NonNull
306  public static <T> List<T> unmodifiableList(@NonNull List<T> list) {
307    return Collections.unmodifiableList(list);
308  }
309
310  /**
311   * An implementation of {@link Collections#singletonList(Object)} that respects
312   * non-nullness.
313   *
314   * @param <T>
315   *          the Java type of the list items
316   * @param instance
317   *          the singleton item to use
318   * @return an unmodifiable list containing the singleton item
319   */
320  @SuppressWarnings("null")
321  @NonNull
322  public static <T> List<T> singletonList(@NonNull T instance) {
323    return Collections.singletonList(instance);
324  }
325
326  /**
327   * An implementation of {@link Collections#emptyMap()} that respects
328   * non-nullness.
329   *
330   * @param <K>
331   *          the Java type of the map's keys
332   * @param <V>
333   *          the Java type of the map's values
334   * @return an unmodifiable empty map
335   */
336  @SuppressWarnings("null")
337  @NonNull
338  public static <K, V> Map<K, V> emptyMap() {
339    return Collections.emptyMap();
340  }
341
342  /**
343   * An implementation of {@link Collections#singletonMap(Object, Object)} that
344   * respects non-nullness.
345   *
346   * @param <K>
347   *          the Java type of the map's keys
348   * @param <V>
349   *          the Java type of the map's values
350   * @param key
351   *          the singleton key
352   * @param value
353   *          the singleton value
354   * @return an unmodifiable map containing the singleton entry
355   */
356  @SuppressWarnings("null")
357  @NonNull
358  public static <K, V> Map<K, V> singletonMap(@NonNull K key, @NonNull V value) {
359    return Collections.singletonMap(key, value);
360  }
361
362  /**
363   * An implementation of {@link Collections#unmodifiableMap(Map)} that respects
364   * non-nullness.
365   *
366   * @param map
367   *          the map to prevent modification of
368   * @param <K>
369   *          the Java type of the map's keys
370   * @param <V>
371   *          the Java type of the map's values
372   * @return an unmodifiable view of the map
373   */
374  @SuppressWarnings("null")
375  @NonNull
376  public static <K, V> Map<K, V> unmodifiableMap(@NonNull Map<K, V> map) {
377    return Collections.unmodifiableMap(map);
378  }
379
380  private CollectionUtil() {
381    // disable construction
382  }
383}
